page.title: 17Transport in Hungerford.
page.content: A survey of the parents at our school showed that about half work in Hungerford,the other half travelling to 15 other places,the furthest of these being London,some 60 miles away. Most use a private car to travel to and from their place of work although many who work in Hungerford travel on foot.The average time to travel to work is 25 minutes. A traffic census taken by a mini roundabout on the A4 on a Wednesday afternoon gave us the following information.Six hundred vehicles an hour passed through Hungerford and of these some 540 were cars.The rest were different kinds of transport.There were 24 lorries,20 vans,20 motor bikes,8 coaches,16 bicycles and 4 tractors.For the 30 minutes of the count not one public transport bus was seen!
